alert.note: Alert for Amite; Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 1:52PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern St. Helena, northwestern Tangipahoa and northwestern Washington Parishes, southern Pike and southeastern Amite Counties through 215 PM CDT... At 152 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kentwood, or 9 miles northeast of Greensburg, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kentwood, Osyka, Mount Herman and Tangipahoa. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 54 and 66. Interstate 55 in Mississippi between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
